net.xeoh.plugins.remote

Enum PublishMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<PublishMethod>
      • net.xeoh.plugins.remote.PublishMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PublishMethod>

    public enum PublishMethod
extends java.lang.Enum<PublishMethod>
    How an implementation publishes something. As this enum is only hardly extensible from outside, we have to list here all possible methods beforehand, so other might implement the plugins and use a value from in here. Currently, we only have XMLRPC. Note: All Remote plugins also should use the @Capabilities annotation to tell their functionality.
    Author:
    Ralf Biedert
    See Also:
    RemoteAPI

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ERMI
      Essence RMI plugin.
      JAVASCRIPT
      Make plugins accessible by JavaScript (currently defunct)
      JSON
      Make plugins accessible by JavaScript through Jabsorb (JSON).
      LIPE
      Lipe RMI appears to be the first sensible RMI provider that supports callbacks.
      OTHER
      In case you implemented a method not specified here.
      XMLRPC
      Use XMLRPC for communication.
      XMLRPCDELIGHT
      DFKI's XMLRPC Delight service

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • ERMI

        public static final PublishMethod ERMI
        Essence RMI plugin.

      • OTHER

        public static final PublishMethod OTHER
        In case you implemented a method not specified here. Use Capabilities then.

      • XMLRPC

        public static final PublishMethod XMLRPC
        Use XMLRPC for communication. Might have problems with void or null.

      • XMLRPCDELIGHT

        public static final PublishMethod XMLRPCDELIGHT
        DFKI's XMLRPC Delight service

      • JAVASCRIPT

        public static final PublishMethod JAVASCRIPT
        Make plugins accessible by JavaScript (currently defunct)

      • JSON

        public static final PublishMethod JSON
        Make plugins accessible by JavaScript through Jabsorb (JSON). Note that browser restrictions might prevent you from using the plugin properly.

      • LIPE

        public static final PublishMethod LIPE
        Lipe RMI appears to be the first sensible RMI provider that supports callbacks. The version we use however was hacked a bit to support automatic export of interfaces and contains less bugs and deadlocks. Preferred way of exporting plugins!

    System.out.println(c);
